content:
This existence of domains and their motion in  $\mathbf{B}_0$  are not speculations.

One may observe this under a microscope after sprinkling a liquid suspension of powdered ferromagnetic substance of samples.

This motion of suspension can be observed.

Fig.

5.8(b) shows the situation when the domains have aligned and amalgamated to form a single 'giant' domain.
summary: A liquid suspension of powdered ferromagnetic substance can exhibit domain motion, leading to the observation of this phenomenon under a microscope.
hypothetical_questions: How does the existence of domains contribute to the observed motion in the suspension?
What effect does the magnetostatic field, $	extbf{B}_0$, have on the domain motion?
